title.narrative: OP2: BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, national and sub-national Government Ministries and other key stakeholders have improved capacity to implement and monitor inclusive, equitable and quality basic education services, focusing on early grades., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national and sub-national Government Ministries and other key stakeholders have improved capacity to implement and monitor inclusive, equitable and quality ECE services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, national and sub-national Government Ministries and other key stakeholders have improved capacity to implement and monitorinclusive, equitable and quality basic education services, focusing on early grades.

description.narrative: National and sub-national capacities to support schools improve teaching-learning are being strengthened through the enhanced school development planning process using the fundamental quality standards developed with UNICEF support. The clear link to monitoring whether children are learning and ongoing support to institutionalize a cost-effective pedagogical advisory support system for teachers contributes to improving learning outcomes for primary education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/01/2022
